Element.name: entry
Element.description: Data type (free text or controlled vocabulary)

Element.name: DC equivalent
Element.description: Equivalent of the term in Dublin Core metadata elements

Element.name: Repeatable
Element.description: Whether the same term can be used in multiple terms (Yes or No)

Element.name: Modality
Element.description: Degree of necessity (Mandatory, Optional, Strongly Suggested, Mandatory if)

identification.definition: An alphanumeric identifier for the record created for the IF Repository.
identification.guideline: The PIs of each project will receive a pre-assigned unique project identifier. Unique ID's derivered from that ID and adding 4 digit secuential numbers.
identification.definition: Shows the parent collection or object which this record related to/part of.
identification.guideline: International or local identifiers associated with the original material.
identification.example: CO 1/25 (National Archives Reference), 309.6 P.97 (Dewey Classification Number), AGN COL CI Folder 75, Document 2 (ISADG classification), 2019SG07-0239 (Unique ID of a digital collection)
identification.definition: Shows the parent collection or object which this record related to/part of.
identification.guideline: Provide the name of the project as it is on the "Projects" sheet.
identification.example: Vernacular Songs as Archives and Modes of Social Redress in Jamestown, Accra
identification.definition: The name given to the resource by the Creator (depositor) in any language.
identification.guideline: Provide a short title for the resource in any language. Do not use any punctuation. Only capitalize the first alphabet of the project title, acronyms and any personal and geographic names.
identification.example: Aso wiwo awon obinrin ile Yoruba
identification.definition: The name given to the resource by the Creator (depositor) in other language.
identification.guideline: Provide a translation or modified version of the title attributed to the record.
identification.example: Local-made cloth of a typical Ghanian lady
identification.definition: Name of the digital file or the folder of multiple files.
identification.guideline: Provide the name of the digital file. Or if you have more than one file to represent, provide the path of the folder.
identification.definition: Name of the website where this resource was published.
URL of the website where this resource was published.

ContentAndStructure.definition: The file format, physical medium or dimension of the source.
Size or duration of the source.

A textual description of the content of the resource (knowledge profile = images; documents) in any language, including event and significance connected to the resource. Content descriptions in the case of visual resources.
ContentAndStructure.guideline: Provide textual description of the resource in English limited to maximum of three concise sentences. Include important keywords related to the significance of the resource. Since the description field is a potentially rich source of indexable vocabulary, care should be taken to provide this element when possible.
ContentAndStructure.example: Ile alo ti awon omode eya Arika lo ni odun to ti pe
ContentAndStructure.definition: A textual description of the content of the resource in other language, including event and significance connected to the resource. Content descriptions in the case of visual resources.
ContentAndStructure.guideline: Provide textual description of the resource in other language limited to maximum of three concise sentences. Include important keywords related to the significance of the resource. Since the description field is a potentially rich source of indexable vocabulary, care should be taken to provide this element when possible.
ContentAndStructure.example: Story book used for play by Pandalong children to understand the direction of the moon and sun. Created between 1908 and 1910.
ContentAndStructure.definition: The primary language spoken by the participant (if video or audio resource). The primary language written on the image or in the document.
ContentAndStructure.guideline: Select the primary language spoken in the audio or video file. Select the primary language written on the image or in the document.
ContentAndStructure.definition: The other language spoken by the participant (if video or audio resource). The other language written on the image or in the document.
ContentAndStructure.guideline: Select the other language spoken in the audio or video file. Select the other language written on the image or in the document.
ContentAndStructure.definition: Descriptive words that are most significant and unique to the resource
ContentAndStructure.guideline: Provide maximum of five most significant and unique words that can describe the content of the resource. Separate each word with comma.
ContentAndStructure.definition: Descriptive words that are most significant and unique to the resource.
ContentAndStructure.guideline: Provide maximum of five most significant and unique words that can describe the content of the resource. Separate each word with comma.
ContentAndStructure.definition: Any information that you want to add about this data, if you can not find a metadata field according to your need.

GeographicalCoverage.definition: The name of the country connected to the resource, where the content of the resource took place.
GeographicalCoverage.guideline: Provide the name of the country that is connected to the resource.
GeographicalCoverage.definition: The name of the region or state connected to the resource, where the content of the resource took place.
GeographicalCoverage.guideline: Provide the name of the region/state/province that is connected to the resource.
GeographicalCoverage.definition: The name of the place/street name/area connected to the resource, where the content of the resource took place.
GeographicalCoverage.guideline: Provide the name of the place/street name/area that is connected to the resource.
GeographicalCoverage.definition: This element captures the names of places that do not have specific geographical coordinates or are of imaginary or mythical nature.
GeographicalCoverage.guideline: Provide the name of a place or space.

SocioculturalContext.definition: The cultural or ethnic group connected to the resource.
SocioculturalContext.guideline: Provide the names of all the cultural or ethnic group/community connected to the resource. This could be more than one.
SocioculturalContext.definition: The cultural event or context associated with the resource.
SocioculturalContext.guideline: Describe the cultural context or event associated with the resource. This descriptor responds to ‘What was happening when the resource was produced?’, ‘What event or practice is the resource recording?’ A list of suggested events is provided but add additional, more specific values to the vocabulary.
SocioculturalContext.definition: The social group associated with or recorded by the resource.
SocioculturalContext.guideline: Describe the social group associated with the resource. This descriptor responds to ‘What is the description of the people recorded by the resources?’ A list of suggested social group is provided but add additional, more specific values to the vocabulary. e.g. https://simplicable.com/society/social-groups

Technology.definition: The defined way adopted to produce the resource.
Technology.guideline: Describe the technique used in producing the resource. This descriptor responds to ‘How was the resource produced?’ A list of relevant production technique is provided but additional techniques can be added.
Technology.definition: The equipment used directly for the production of the resource.
Technology.guideline: List all the equipment used for the production of the resource. Provide the general names of each equipment, separated with commas.

Dates.definition: A point or period of time associated with the creation of the resource.
Dates.guideline: Enter the date the resource was created. Recommended practice is to express date using the format YYYY-MM-DD [ISO 8601-1]. If the full date is unknown, month and year (YYYY-MM) or just year (YYYY) may be used.
Dates.definition: A point or period of time associated with the digitisation of the resource. E.g. scanning, photographing date.
Dates.guideline: Enter the date the resource was created. Recommended practice is to express date using the format YYYY-MM-DD [ISO 8601-1]. If the full date is unknown, month and year (YYYY-MM) or just year (YYYY) may be used.

Enter the date the resource was created. Recommended practice is to express date using the format YYYY-MM-DD [ISO 8601-1]. If the full date is unknown, month and year (YYYY-MM) or just year (YYYY) may be used.

AccessAndSensitivity.definition: Information about the individual/community/groups/organisation who owns the rights in and over the resource.
AccessAndSensitivity.guideline: Select the participant or community that owns the rights in and over the resource from the participants vocabulary. You can add names of individual/community/organisation that are not on the list to the vocabulary list, then here.
AccessAndSensitivity.definition: Information about the shareability, distribution and adaptation of the resource.
AccessAndSensitivity.guideline: Select which licence is applicable to the resource. Consider this carefully before making your selection.
AccessAndSensitivity.definition: This refers to the attributed standard that governs the content and knowledge of the resources and who can access the resource.
AccessAndSensitivity.guideline: Select the level of cultural sensitivity of the content and knowledge of the resource. Consider this carefully before making your selection. ---Highly sensitive – refers to resource that cannot be viewed, downloaded, print nor accessed. The resources in this category are confidential. The depositor, persons connected to the project and repository administrators may have access to the resource. ;Moderately sensitive – refers to resources that are to be viewed only, not to be downloaded and print. Retrievers interested in accessing the resource need to fill ‘Data Retrieval Form’ to justify the need for the resource. Data Retrieval Form to be assessed and approved by the Principal Investigator and co-PIs ;Low sensitivity – refers to resources that are to be shared openly. Retrievers will be able to view, download, print and use
AccessAndSensitivity.example: Highly sensitive, Medium sensitivity, Low sensitivity
AccessAndSensitivity.definition: This refers to availability of the resource.
AccessAndSensitivity.guideline: Select the level of access that is appropriate to the resource. Consider this carefully before making your selection. ---Yes – refers to resources that are restricted. If you choose ‘Yes’, you need to justify ;No – refers to resources with no access restriction. Resources will be made openly available.
AccessAndSensitivity.definition: Justification for limiting access to the resources.
AccessAndSensitivity.guideline: The field is mandatory if the value for ‘Access restriction’ is Yes. Provide justifications for limiting the access to the resource and specify the consequences and potential impacts of making the resource accessible. Specify if access to the resource should ne restricted permanently or for a specific period of time.
AccessAndSensitivity.example: The image records various civil protests and disobedience is countries that are repressive. Making the image accessible could make the persons connected to the image targets. Therefore, access to the image should be permanently restricted.
AccessAndSensitivity.definition: Shows users how to cite this data when they want to reproduce or refer to it.
AccessAndSensitivity.guideline: A spesific, permenent and searchable info about this data (such as ID) or a perminent url can be used.

IntellectualProperty.definition: The individual that is primarily responsible for the production of the resource.
IntellectualProperty.guideline: Select the participant that is primarily responsible for the production of the resource. If many participants are involved, select the lead person for the production of the resource and list other as contributors.
IntellectualProperty.definition: The individuals that supported the creator or contributed to the production of the resource.
IntellectualProperty.guideline: List all the individuals that contributed or supported the production of the resources. Separate each contributor with commas.
